title: Step Seven
subtitle: We humbly asked Him to remove our shortcomings.

questions.prompt: What shortcomings cause the most problems for me?
What shortcomings do I most want God to remove?
Am I ready to ask for help with all my shortcomings?
What does humility mean to me?
How has my understanding of humility changed?
Do I have trouble asking for help? Why or why not?
How does humility help me ask for help?
How does my new perception of myself make me more humble?
How do I ask my Higher Power to remove my shortcomings?
What have I asked for?
Do I expect God to just take my shortcomings without any effort on my part?
Am I willing to not act on my shortcomings?
What action can I take to improve my conscious contact with the God of my understanding?
How does my Third Step decision to turn my will and life over to God's care fit into working the Seventh Step?
What gives me the faith that a Higher Power will remove my shortcomings?
How have I learned to rely upon my Higher Power?
What does it mean to have my shortcomings removed?
Do I expect to be perfect after my shortcomings are removed?
Do I realize that I may still be tempted by my shortcomings after they've been removed?
What is my part in having my shortcomings removed?
How can I avoid acting on my shortcomings?
Am I willing to have all my shortcomings removed?
Are there any I don't want to have removed? Which ones? Why?
How has my life changed since my shortcomings began to be removed?
How have I practiced humility in my life today?
Have I asked my Higher Power to remove a shortcoming today?
Am I willing to keep the focus on myself?
How does openness help me in my recovery?
How am I practicing willingness and surrender in my life today?
How have I been changed by working this step?
What new feelings have I experienced as my shortcomings have been removed?
